```{.r .cell-code}
# nb is neighbour and wt is weight
# we use st_contiguity to create a neighbour object from geometry. 
# Then we use st_weights to create a weight object from the neighbour object.
# .before = 1 will put inside from the first column 

wm_q <- hunanGDPPC %>%
  mutate(nb = st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb, 
                        style = "W"),
         .before = 1)
```
:::


moran I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
global_moran_test(wm_q$GDPPC,
                  wm_q$nb,
                  wm_q$wt)
```

now, since people will question your wj we will use permutate to test the significance of the moran I

```{.r .cell-code}

                  wm_q$nb,
                  wm_q$wt,
                 nsim = 99)
```
